thread.title: The NBA expects a lot out of the Bulls but doesn't believe they have a star
thread.title_full: The NBA expects a lot out of the Bulls but doesn't believe they have a star | Chicago Sun-Times

author: | emailAddress.indexOf('@') == -1) {errorString = 'Please enter your email address';} var isError = false; if (errorString.length > 0) isError = true; if (isError) alert(errorString); return !isError;}
title: The NBA expects a lot out of the Bulls but doesn't believe they have a star
text:
Every year as the regular approaches NBA general managers are asked to fill out a survey on what they expect in the coming season. Tuesday, the league released the results.
One thing is pretty clear as far as the Chicago outlook; the rest of the league expects the Bulls to win a lot, but for no real reason. Despite having the highest percentage of second place votes Eastern Conference rankings, the Bulls have few individual accolades.
The GMs were asked to rank just about every talent needed to be an NBA player. Everything from the player who forces the most adjustments to the most underrated player acquisition.
Bulls players were left off most of the rankings, but a few found themselves receiving votes. Jimmy Butler brought in the most attention, Butler was ranked as the third best perimeter defender and tied for the third toughest. He also received votes for being among the best shooting guards and player who best moves without the ball.
Fred Hoiberg was ranked third among coaches in a new job who will make the biggest impact. Rookie Bobby Portis was deemed the second biggest steal of the draft and Pau Gasol was the ranked as the second best international player.
Outside of Hoiberg, Portis, Gasol and Butler, no other Bulls received enough votes to be included in anything higher than the “also receiving votes” category of a question.
Derrick Rose was noticeably left off the results all together. The former MVP didn’t receive any votes as one of the best point guards, leaders or any other question asked.
Of course, the survey has to be taken with a grain of salt. At least some of the GMs included Tom Thibodeau as one of the head coaches with the best defensive schemes. Of course, Thibodeau is not currently a head coach.
